Joryu (壌竜じょうりゅう, Jōryū) is one of the Hachiraishin, consisting of the so-called Gods who rule over the Shuuki.

00:00

41:20




Appearance
Joryu is a tall dark-skinned young woman who has long light hair, black eyebrows that are cut rather shor. A pair of antler-like horns sat atop her head. A pair of elongated ears, and black markings that cover her stomach.

It is noted that she is rather naked aside from the white armor that covers her abundant chest, waist, in addition to gauntlets and greaves.

Personality
Contrasting her fellow Rairashin, Joryu is rather stoic and less talkative, never speaking aside from when Shikoku is talking to her. She tends to agree with most of what Shikoku says, as opposed to Rairen.

Despite her stoicness, Joryu is willing to humor her fellow Shuki's request, playing along with Shikoku's antics and helping out with her plans. In addition, Joryu cared for her fellow Hachiraishin as seen with her mourning Kusetsu's death and desire to avenge her. Joryu's love was strong enough to the point she willingly agree with Rairen's proposition, something she rarely does.

Background


Plot
Powers and Abilities
As one of the Eight Thunder Gods, Joryu is among the eight strongest residents of Mato, considered one of the "Gods" in Mato, a testament to this, she overpowered Shushu, Himari, Yachiho, Sahara, Aoba, Kidoumaru, and Kumadoji using a single attack from stomping her feet. She and the members also has supreme reign over all of the Shuuki who inhabits Mato.

Earth Manipulation: Joryu has some degree of control over the power of "earth". She is able to conjure rocks at will to cover her body.

Healing: Through the power of earth, Joryu is able to heal other people. Joryu and the subject must both be naked and in physical contact for the healing to take effect.
Physical Abilities
Immense Strength: She has immense strength, remaining unaffected after Aoba tries to free herself, then tosses her aside using a single motion of her hand.[1] With her strength alone, she is capable of tearing apart and easily defeating Yuki's slave form enhanced by Ren Yamashiro.

Immense Durability: Joryu is extremely durable. She is capable of taking head on attacks from Yuki's slave form and Ren Yamashiro, yet she remains relatively unscathed.

Flight: Joryu is capable of flight, because of the white wings on her back.
